Miko Mälberg (born May 3, 1985 in Tallinn) is an Estonian freestyle swimmer. He competed for his native country at the 2008 Summer Olympics in Beijing, China, where he finished in 25th place in the men's 50 metre freestyle clocking 22.37 seconds in the preliminary.
^ Miko Mälberg 50 m vabaltujumises 25.

people.name: Miko Mälberg
people.aboutText:
Kadri Lehtla (born May 3, 1985 in Tallinn) is an Estonian biathlete. At the 2010 Winter Olympics in Vancouver she finished 18th in the 4×6 km relay, 45th in the 15 km individual and 64th in the 7.5 km sprint.
^ "Kadri Lehtla, Biathlon".

people.name: Meagan Tandy
people.aboutText: Meagan Yvonne Tandy (born May 3, 1985) is an American actress and model. She is a former Miss California USA who was one of 5 finalists competing for the Miss USA title where she placed 3rd Runner up. Her most notable work was when she played Denzel Washington's daughter Maya in the Tony Scott directed film "Unstoppable".

people.name: Danila Kozlovsky
people.aboutText: Danila Valerievich Kozlovsky (Russian: Данила Валерьевич Козловский; born 3 May 1985) is a Russian film and theatre actor and model.

people.name: Lina Grinčikaitė
people.aboutText:
Lina Grinčikaitė-Samuolė (born 3 May 1987 in Klaipėda) is a track and field sprint athlete, who competes internationally for Lithuania.
Grinčikaitė represented Lithuania at the 2008 Summer Olympics in Beijing. She competed at the 100 metres sprint and placed third in her first round heat after Chandra Sturrup and Kelly-Ann Baptiste in a time of 11.43 seconds.

people.name: Ben Revere
people.aboutText: Benjamin Daniel Revere (born May 3, 1988) is an American professional baseball outfielder for the Washington Nationals of Major League Baseball (MLB). Revere was born in Atlanta, Georgia, and raised in LaGrange, Georgia, though he eventually moved to Richmond, Kentucky. He played baseball at Lexington Catholic High School, where he received several awards during his junior and senior seasons.

people.name: Nadia Forde
people.aboutText: Mary Danielle Lambert (born May 3, 1989) is a Seattle-based singer, songwriter and spoken word artist. She worked with Macklemore and Ryan Lewis on a track on their album The Heist. Lambert is the featured artist of their gay rights single, "Same Love".

people.name: Mary Lambert
people.aboutText: Nadia Forde (born 3 May 1989) is an Irish model, singer and actress. She participated in the fourteenth series of the hit ITV show I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here!, starting on 16 November 2014 and ending on 2 December, finishing in ninth place. and has appeared in her own show Nadia Goes to Hollywood.

people.name: Taylor Trensch
people.aboutText: Taylor Trensch (born May 3, 1989) is an American stage actor. Trensch was born in Tampa, Florida. He attended Elon University in North Carolina.

people.name: Miranda Chartrand
people.aboutText: Miranda Chartrand (born 3 May 1990) and Adam Nichols (born 10 September 1991) are a musical duo. They met and began working together through the BBC television series Chartjackers, which was challenging the online community to write, record and release a pop song through crowdsourcing in ten weeks. After initially auditioning through separate YouTube videos, Chartrand and Nichols then successfully auditioned in person to provide vocals on the single.

people.name: Levi Johnston
people.aboutText: Levi Keith Johnston (born May 3, 1990) is the former fiancé of Bristol Palin. He first received media attention in August 2008 when U.S. vice presidential candidate Sarah Palin announced that her daughter Bristol was five months pregnant with Johnston's baby and that the two were engaged. Ultimately, the couple ended their relationship, and Johnston and the Palin family engaged in several public feuds.

people.name: Maddy O'Reilly
people.aboutText: Maddy O'Reilly (born Emily Nicholson on May 3, 1990) is an American pornographic actress.

people.name: Bela Padilla
people.aboutText: Krista Valle Sullivan (born 3 May 1991), better known by her stage name Bela Padilla, is a Filipina actress and model.

people.name: Lindsay Bushman
people.aboutText: Lindsay Bushman (born May 3, 1994) is an American actress who is best known for her role on The Young and the Restless as Summer Newman.

people.name: Zach Sobiech
people.aboutText: Mary Cecilia Cain (born May 3, 1996) is a professional American middle distance runner from Bronxville, New York. Cain is the 2014 World Junior Champion in the 3000 meter event. She is the youngest American athlete ever to represent the United States at a World Championships meet after competing in the 2013 World Championships in Athletics in Moscow.

people.name: Mary Cain
people.aboutText: This article includes, in addition to Zach Sobiech, coverage of the activities of the band A Firm Handshake

people.name: Noah Munck
people.aboutText: Noah Bryant Munck (born May 3, 1996) is an American actor and music producer. He is best known for his role as Gibby in the Nickelodeon series iCarly, and for his appearances as Bobby Sinclair, the junior lawn-mowing entrepreneur in the TruGreen commercials.

people.name: Domantas Sabonis
people.aboutText: Domantas Sabonis (born May 3, 1996) is a Lithuanian basketball player who currently plays college basketball for Gonzaga University. He previously played in Spain for Unicaja Málaga's junior and senior teams, although he never signed a professional contract. He is the son of the Lithuanian basketball player Arvydas Sabonis, and was born in Portland, Oregon while his father was playing for the Portland Trail Blazers.

people.name: Ivana Jorović
people.aboutText:
Ruelleen Angel Olano (born May 3, 2006), better known by her stage name Mutya Orquia, is a Filipina child actress, known for her titular role as a mermaid in Mutya, and as Abigail Ruth "Abby" Lim in Be Careful With My Heart. She also played the young Jade Dimagiba in "My Binondo Girl".
In early October, Orquia was announced to be featured in Shake, Rattle & Roll 14, an official entry to the annual Metro Manila Film Festival.

people.name: Mutya Orquia
people.aboutText:
Ivana Jorović (Serbian Cyrillic: Ивана Јоровић; born 3 May 1997 in Čačak) is a Serbian tennis player.
Jorović has won eight singles and one doubles title on the ITF tour in her career. On 21 December 2015, she reached her best singles ranking of world number 190.
